Senior Tory Crispin Blunt has said that his Party was in “deep trouble” and suggested fellow MPs consider “some kind of electoral arrangement” with the Brexit Party. This would involve Conservative candidates not standing in seats they do not already hold. This would mean Conservative voters, not already in a Conservative constituency, will not get the chance to vote for a Tory. This shows clearly how scared the Tories are of the Brexit Party!!  https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/politics/tory-mp-demands-conservatives-form-15803105

Theresa May has announced that she will bring her Brexit Deal back to the House of Commons during the week commencing June 3rd, for a fourth Meaningful Vote. This will occur regardless of an agreement with the Labour Party being reached.  Already the DUP has criticised May's decision and many predict her Deal to fail yet again! The British public has made clear that we do not want her Deal. It does not deliver on the result of the Referendum and it is not what we voted for. We voted to take back complete control of our money, borders and laws. The only way to achieve this is to leave the EU without a Deal, on WTO Terms!  https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2019/05/14/theresa-may-tells-cabinet-give-another-three-months-get-brexit/

I bought some food waste bags in M&S recently - not advertised on the wrapper, but stamped on the bags ‘Produced in the EU’. Noticed same on many items in M&S. They are taking over from Waitrose with Ocado, so let Ocado know they MUST start stocking British, or we will order from Waitrose and ALL other supermarkets in the UK - which STRONGLY support and stock British / UK goods! WE DO NOT NEED EU PRODUCTS. BREXIT POWER OF THE PEOPLE Jayne Adye, Director  Get Britain OutMAKING MY BREXIT STAND… BOUGHT BRITISH TODAY  Only a few things but surprisingly easy! Downfall was lemons - and a compromise on the orange juice - pressed in this country BUT didn’t say where the oranges came from. Could have bought an English honey but I like dark honey so again, a compromise for one made from NON-EU honeys. There are plenty of local honey producers though, so not a future problem.  Dove soap is made in Germany so that went back on the shelf unfortunately but ‘hey ho’ Pears soap is produced in India so was able to avoid the EU. Haven’t used Pears soap for years - will be an interesting experience. So I ended up with British milk British tomatoes British Potatoes – Jersey potatoes were also available British eggs British Wiltshire produced soup Scottish smoked salmon  Honey from non-EU countries produced in the UK Orange juice squeezed in the UK Soap produced in India Probably more of a challenge when it comes to cleaning products & toiletries – we’ll see. N.B. Sorry for the labels - we just don't seem to be able to get away from May 😉

Perfect description of the Brexit situation in today's Telegraph:-                                SIR – In observing that the arithmetic in the House of Commons is opposed to leaving without a deal” (report May 4) Michael Gove states: “We have to face facts.”  Well here are some facts Mr Gove would do well to face: that in a referendum, held by the Government precisely so that a definitive answer would be obtained, the electorate voted to leave; that the voting options, “Leave” or “Remain” were unequivocal; that the Government pledged that it would “implement what you decide”; that had the result been a majority vote to remain, the matter would have been considered to have been answered unequivocally; that both major parties in the 2017 election promised to honour the referendum result; that constant references to “hardline Brexiteers” is a political (that is dishonest) way of describing those honourable MPs who simply wish to respect the people’s decision; that, deal or no deal, the Government is both duty – and honour-bound – to see that Britain leaves the EU. It is Parliament’s wilful refusal to face these facts that has led directly to where we are today – not least to the coming destruction of the Conservative Party. It is both contemptible and beyond parody that Mr Gove should now exhort us all to “face facts” when these facts are the ones he and his like have wilfully brought into being by deliberately not facing those engendered by the referendum, and which the British people were given every assurance would be acted upon. Philip J Ashe Leeds, West Yorkshire
